question.questionText: Denise made a circuit to light a bulb or run a motor off a D-cell battery. She used a special switch. Below is the schematic diagram of her circuit. The switch is inside the dotted box. Why will the bulb light when she moves the switch to the left?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: There is a complete circuit connecting the bulb to the D-cell battery.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: That will happen because it is a complete circuit.
Because when you turn it left the circuit is open which means it goes off.
Because she only has one switch.
Moving the switch the light bulb will make it light up.
